main event: Ground observers at Fort Sill, Oklahoma spotted a reddish-orange object in the sky on October 8, 1959.
interesting points: The object appeared to be the size of a dime, but through a scope it appeared larger.
The object hovered and then moved off, changing in brightness and color during the sighting.
The object was observed for about 10 minutes and did not make any sound.
Ground observers at a separate location in Lawton, Oklahoma also spotted the object at around 15 degrees above the horizon.
The object was observed to move laterally for about 200 yards, slowing down and increasing in light intensity, before returning to its original position and then disappearing.
result: Possibly a weather balloon, but not conclusively identified.
sighted object: A reddish-orange object in the sky
witnesses: Ground observers, including military personnel and civilians
